p: We observed that PA24 and PA63 did not markedly decrease viral entry at the lower concentrations tested, corroborating the findings of a previous study that tested Retro-1 and Retro-2 ( Sivan et al., 2016) ( Figure 2B). While a higher concentration (10 Î¼M) of PA24 and PA63 reduced viral entry, for PA104 a decrease in viral entry was observed at all three concentrations tested ( Figure 2B). To exclude the possibility that these compounds affect the enzymatic activity of luciferase, we added different concentrations of PA104 to lysed VACV WR-Luc-infected cells just before the addition of the substrate. We found no difference in luciferase activity between the treatment groups ( Supplementary Figure S1B). Together, these data demonstrate that potent retrograde inhibitors may inhibit virus entry at high concentrations.
